0.title: Salesforce DevOps (Direct Applicants Only please)
0.description: We are looking for a highly skilled Salesforce DevOps Engineer to join our team! The ideal candidate will have expertise in CI/CD pipeline management, Salesforce DX, version control, and release management within Salesforce environments.Key Responsibilities:CI/CD Pipeline Management: Lead the setup, configuration, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines for Salesforce applications. Utilize tools such as GitHub, Jenkins, Salesforce DX, Copado, or Gearset to automate deployments across Sandbox, UAT, and Production environments. Ensure efficient and error-free deployments with robust automation and monitoring processes.Salesforce DX & Version Control: Implement and maintain Salesforce DX to streamline development workflows and enable source-driven development. Enforce best practices for version control using Git repositories, ensuring effective branching strategies, commit policies, and pull request workflows to maintain high code quality and collaboration.Release Management: Oversee and coordinate the deployment of multiple releases in a Salesforce environment. Ensure seamless transitions between development, QA, UAT, and production by defining and executing structured release processes, rollback strategies, and environment management techniques. Work closely with cross-functional teams to resolve deployment challenges and maintain system stability.LOCATION REQUIRED: 3 days in-office in Sunnyvale California OR Austin Texas (non-negotiable)EEO & Pay transparency Statement: Silverline provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

50.title: M365 - IT Application Dev Engineer, Kuiper Production Operations
50.description: DescriptionProject Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.Export Control Requirements: Due to the need to access certain federal controlled information, you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.Kuiper M365 Engineering team configures, deploys and manages M365 productivity services, enabling collaboration through secure, reliable, and highly-available services. These services empower the daily operations for Kuiper Manufacturing and Kuiper Government Solutions. We are seeking an M365 engineer to efficiently design, implement, and operate M365 suite in GCC High Environment. Primary focus will be on maintaining reliable and secure M365 collaborations services, troubleshooting issues, and providing engineering support to our team.Key job responsibilitiesKey job responsibilities Design and implement Productivity application in Kuiper environments using Infrastructure as Code. Identify, research, recommend, and implement Microsoft 365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Serve as the administrator for M365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Enforce compliance with principals including: least privilege access, password management, Audit logging for all productivity applications. Drive 3rd party secure collaboration efforts to accelerate Kuiper projects. Partner with Amazon security organizations to ensure compliance with existing security policies. Engage with and influence the key stakeholders and internal teams to ensure compliance, security and operational functional requirements are met or exceeded. Create and implement automated processes that reduce manual efforts and increase overall efficiency and scalability. Develop monitoring and reporting on the health, effectiveness and efficiency of productivity services. Develop and maintain documentation for the Microsoft 365 environment for both engineering audience as well as end users,A day in the lifeAs a member of KM365 you will join our morning standups to discuss progress on projects and services across the team. On meeting days, you will attend Operations reviews, Document reviews, and project meetings. The team also has dedicated engineering days where you will be heads down on development, operations, and support.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical team. While you will come to our team with your own diverse experience, you will have the ability to further develop your skills and grow your career within one of our most innovative programs. Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong communication skills and has project management experience. You should expect to work in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment.About The TeamThis team collaborate with Amazon Security teams and key stakeholders to intake requirements and deliver a customer productivity experience to Project Kuiper specific resources.Basic Qualifications 3+ years of hands-on systems engineering experience Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems) Administrative experience in networking, storage systems, operating systems Experience with PowerShell (preferred) or Python for automationPreferred Qualifications Experience with M365 services like Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange Experience configuring M365 services with Desired State Configuration (DSC) Experience with CI/CD AWS pipelines Experience working in an Agile environment using the Scrum methodologyAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $104,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.Company - Amazon Kuiper Manufacturing Enterprises LLCJob ID: A2858954

Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.Export Control Requirements: Due to the need to access certain federal controlled information, you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.Kuiper M365 Engineering team configures, deploys and manages M365 productivity services, enabling collaboration through secure, reliable, and highly-available services. These services empower the daily operations for Kuiper Manufacturing and Kuiper Government Solutions. We are seeking an M365 engineer to efficiently design, implement, and operate M365 suite in GCC High Environment. Primary focus will be on maintaining reliable and secure M365 collaborations services, troubleshooting issues, and providing engineering support to our team.Key job responsibilitiesKey job responsibilities Design and implement Productivity application in Kuiper environments using Infrastructure as Code. Identify, research, recommend, and implement Microsoft 365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Serve as the administrator for M365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Enforce compliance with principals including: least privilege access, password management, Audit logging for all productivity applications. Drive 3rd party secure collaboration efforts to accelerate Kuiper projects. Partner with Amazon security organizations to ensure compliance with existing security policies. Engage with and influence the key stakeholders and internal teams to ensure compliance, security and operational functional requirements are met or exceeded. Create and implement automated processes that reduce manual efforts and increase overall efficiency and scalability. Develop monitoring and reporting on the health, effectiveness and efficiency of productivity services. Develop and maintain documentation for the Microsoft 365 environment for both engineering audience as well as end users,A day in the lifeAs a member of KM365 you will join our morning standups to discuss progress on projects and services across the team. On meeting days, you will attend Operations reviews, Document reviews, and project meetings. The team also has dedicated engineering days where you will be heads down on development, operations, and support.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical team. While you will come to our team with your own diverse experience, you will have the ability to further develop your skills and grow your career within one of our most innovative programs. Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong communication skills and has project management experience. You should expect to work in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment.About The TeamThis team collaborate with Amazon Security teams and key stakeholders to intake requirements and deliver a customer productivity experience to Project Kuiper specific resources.Basic Qualifications 3+ years of hands-on systems engineering experience Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems) Administrative experience in networking, storage systems, operating systems Experience with PowerShell (preferred) or Python for automationPreferred Qualifications Experience with M365 services like Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange Experience configuring M365 services with Desired State Configuration (DSC) Experience with CI/CD AWS pipelines Experience working in an Agile environment using the Scrum methodologyAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $104,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. 75.title: Software Development Engineer, Amazon Fulfillment Technology - Space Cube Capacity Management,
75.description: DescriptionAre you an SDE looking for an exciting opportunity to work with latest technologies and make a meaningful impact on Amazon's supply chain? Join the Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) Space Cube Capacity Management team.As a part of the AFT Space Cube team, you will work on developing and maintaining systems that calculate and manage capacity of Amazon's vast network of fulfillment centers. From optimizing inventory allocation and forecasting demand to ensuring optimal inbound and outbound processes, our team is at the forefront of solving complex challenges in the world of e-commerce.You will work with a diverse group of engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to build scalable, reliable, and high-performance software solutions that enable Amazon's customers to receive their orders on time, every time.Join us and help shape the future of Amazon's fulfillment centers!Key job responsibilities Design and Build highly scaled and efficient solutions using the latest AWS technologies and infrastructure. Owning and Maintaining some of the most business critical systems for Amazon that support hundreds of thousands of associates and millions of customer orders per day as they travel through our Fulfillment Centers. Work with partner teams including Product, Science, Operations and other Tech teams to understand problems, ensure solutions solve those problems and iterate once solutions are live. Use Data. We deep dive, analyze interpret and use data on a daily basis to understand problems and fine tune solutions. More than just coding. Engineers are multi-talented at Amazon. You might work on front end, back end, data analysis, internal tools, etc. You are encouraged to explore and invent solutions that best fit the customer problems we solve. Hire and Develop the Best. Deeply involved in the hiring process as well as onboarding and mentoring less experienced engineers. Also continuously learning and developing your own skills.A day in the lifeAs an SDE in Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) Space Cube team, day-to-day you'll work on diverse and challenging tasks like designing new services, supporting AFT’s large infrastructure, collaborating with your team members and cross-functional teams to create better capabilities in Amazon Fulfillment Centers. All the work you will do will ensure that Amazon customers receive their packages on time while all fulfillment processes are safe and compliant for Amazon associates and customers. Working in the AFT Space Cube team is a great opportunity to grow your skills and make a positive impact in the world's largest and most innovative e-commerce company.Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) PlanIf you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!About The TeamAmazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) powers Amazon’s global fulfillment network. We invent and deliver software, hardware, and data science solutions that orchestrate processes, robots, machines, and people. We harmonize the physical and virtual world so Amazon customers can get what they want, when they want it.Outbound FlowAFT’s Outbound Flow team pairs data science with innovative technologies to optimize throughput within every Amazon fulfillment center. 100.title: M365 - IT Application Dev Engineer, Kuiper Production Operations
100.description: DescriptionProject Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.Export Control Requirements: Due to the need to access certain federal controlled information, you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.Kuiper M365 Engineering team configures, deploys and manages M365 productivity services, enabling collaboration through secure, reliable, and highly-available services. These services empower the daily operations for Kuiper Manufacturing and Kuiper Government Solutions. We are seeking an M365 engineer to efficiently design, implement, and operate M365 suite in GCC High Environment. Primary focus will be on maintaining reliable and secure M365 collaborations services, troubleshooting issues, and providing engineering support to our team.Key job responsibilitiesKey job responsibilities Design and implement Productivity application in Kuiper environments using Infrastructure as Code. Identify, research, recommend, and implement Microsoft 365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Serve as the administrator for M365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Enforce compliance with principals including: least privilege access, password management, Audit logging for all productivity applications. Drive 3rd party secure collaboration efforts to accelerate Kuiper projects. Partner with Amazon security organizations to ensure compliance with existing security policies. Engage with and influence the key stakeholders and internal teams to ensure compliance, security and operational functional requirements are met or exceeded. Create and implement automated processes that reduce manual efforts and increase overall efficiency and scalability. Develop monitoring and reporting on the health, effectiveness and efficiency of productivity services. Develop and maintain documentation for the Microsoft 365 environment for both engineering audience as well as end users,A day in the lifeAs a member of KM365 you will join our morning standups to discuss progress on projects and services across the team. On meeting days, you will attend Operations reviews, Document reviews, and project meetings. The team also has dedicated engineering days where you will be heads down on development, operations, and support.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical team. While you will come to our team with your own diverse experience, you will have the ability to further develop your skills and grow your career within one of our most innovative programs. Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong communication skills and has project management experience. You should expect to work in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment.About The TeamThis team collaborate with Amazon Security teams and key stakeholders to intake requirements and deliver a customer productivity experience to Project Kuiper specific resources.Basic Qualifications 3+ years of hands-on systems engineering experience Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems) Administrative experience in networking, storage systems, operating systems Experience with PowerShell (preferred) or Python for automationPreferred Qualifications Experience with M365 services like Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange Experience configuring M365 services with Desired State Configuration (DSC) Experience with CI/CD AWS pipelines Experience working in an Agile environment using the Scrum methodologyAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity.Export Control Requirements: Due to the need to access certain federal controlled information, you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.Kuiper M365 Engineering team configures, deploys and manages M365 productivity services, enabling collaboration through secure, reliable, and highly-available services. These services empower the daily operations for Kuiper Manufacturing and Kuiper Government Solutions. We are seeking an M365 engineer to efficiently design, implement, and operate M365 suite in GCC High Environment. Primary focus will be on maintaining reliable and secure M365 collaborations services, troubleshooting issues, and providing engineering support to our team.Key job responsibilitiesKey job responsibilities Design and implement Productivity application in Kuiper environments using Infrastructure as Code. Identify, research, recommend, and implement Microsoft 365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Serve as the administrator for M365 services such as Teams, SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive, Voice. Enforce compliance with principals including: least privilege access, password management, Audit logging for all productivity applications. Drive 3rd party secure collaboration efforts to accelerate Kuiper projects. Partner with Amazon security organizations to ensure compliance with existing security policies. Engage with and influence the key stakeholders and internal teams to ensure compliance, security and operational functional requirements are met or exceeded. Create and implement automated processes that reduce manual efforts and increase overall efficiency and scalability. Develop monitoring and reporting on the health, effectiveness and efficiency of productivity services. Develop and maintain documentation for the Microsoft 365 environment for both engineering audience as well as end users,A day in the lifeAs a member of KM365 you will join our morning standups to discuss progress on projects and services across the team. On meeting days, you will attend Operations reviews, Document reviews, and project meetings. The team also has dedicated engineering days where you will be heads down on development, operations, and support.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical team. While you will come to our team with your own diverse experience, you will have the ability to further develop your skills and grow your career within one of our most innovative programs. Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong communication skills and has project management experience. You should expect to work in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment.About The TeamThis team collaborate with Amazon Security teams and key stakeholders to intake requirements and deliver a customer productivity experience to Project Kuiper specific resources.Basic Qualifications 3+ years of hands-on systems engineering experience Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems) Administrative experience in networking, storage systems, operating systems Experience with PowerShell (preferred) or Python for automationPreferred Qualifications Experience with M365 services like Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange Experience configuring M365 services with Desired State Configuration (DSC) Experience with CI/CD AWS pipelines Experience working in an Agile environment using the Scrum methodologyAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $104,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. 125.title: IT Application Engineer III, Checkout Engineering
125.description: DescriptionAs an Application Engineer III, you will be a technical leader and strategic player in the Checkout Engineering organization, driving innovation and best practices across multiple teams and functional areas.Lead the design and implementation of large-scale, distributed systems that power critical WWGST services. Drive architectural decisions and best practices across teams to ensure scalability, reliability, and performance of mission-critical applications. Collaborate with product managers and business stakeholders to translate complex requirements into innovative technical solutions.Evaluate and integrate technologies and frameworks to drive innovation and improve processes.Mentor junior engineers to elevate quality and promote best practices. Participate in capacity planning and performance. Troubleshoot complex issues in production environments, performing root cause analysis and implementing robust solutions.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement APIs and services that enable seamless integration between various Amazon platforms.Champion a culture of operational excellence through monitoring, logging, and alerting best practices. Participate in on-call rotations to ensure high availability and rapid incident response for critical systems. Continuously improve system resilience.The ideal candidate will be a recognized technical expert with a track record of efficiently delivering high-impact solutions. You should be able to work outside your primary technical domain, assist in other areas as required, and be regarded as an expert by peers across the organization. Strong communication skills, the ability to influence across divisions, and a commitment to being vocally self-critical are essential for success in this role.Key job responsibilitiesLead the architecture and design of significant development initiatives across major segments of the organization, ensuring high-performance, stable, and scalable solutions.Identify opportunities for automation and improvement, collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement viable solutions.Spearhead projects to design, develop, test, deploy, and support applications, interfaces, and integrations using a variety of tools.Provide expert software advice and consultation, influencing strategic decisions and roadmaps for your functional area.Engage application developers to establish and promote design, coding, and system methodology best practices across the organization.Identify and evaluate new technologies that can be applied to improve systems and overall processes.Mentor and provide technical leadership to team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.Lead technical reviews of large-scale projects, applying your expertise to guide critical decisions and ensure successful outcomes.Drive the definition and implementation of metrics and standards for your team and the broader technical community.Contribute significantly to your group's strategy, planning, and hiring processes, leveraging your deep understanding of business, priorities, and interconnections.Demonstrate excellent judgment balancing short-term and long-term needs, making sound trade-offs benefiting your group and the company.Maintain a system-wide view of solutions and architecture, considering broader impacts.A day in the lifeAs an IT Application Engineer for Checkout systems (POS, Self-Checkout, Hospitality POS), you are responsible for driving the SDLC for business and technical features for the product and services owned by the team. You'll tackle a prioritized backlog of improvements for US stores, focusing on operational excellence. Collaborating with vendors and cross-functional teams, you'll progress high-priority items while providing daily support for critical POS functions. You'll participate in SAFe ceremonies, and engage in architecture discussions. Your expertise will be crucial in mentoring junior members and translating stakeholder requirements into innovative technical solutions that propel our global retail operations forward.About The TeamWe are a small, dynamic team responsible for the Point of Sale (POS) systems in WWGST's Whole Foods Market stores. Our work is critical to the smooth operation of all retail locations in US market. We collaborate closely with third-party software vendors to optimize our core POS solution, while also working directly with operations partners, product teams, and other technical and support teams across WWGST. Our mission is to continuously improve the POS experience for both our store associates and customers, driving operational excellence.Basic QualificationsBA/BS degree and 6-8 years’ relevant experience OR equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.Preferred QualificationsMS degree and 6-8 years’ relevant experience OR equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A2932269

150.title: DevOps - Sr. SRE, AR - GRD (FF)
150.description: DescriptionAre you passionate about advancing automated material handling systems and robotics? Do you thrive on solving complex automation challenges through collaborative innovation? If you're excited about seeing your work transform modern robotics and material handling operations, you'll be a perfect fit at Automation Integration Technologies (AIT). We are a team of innovative problem-solvers dedicated to revolutionizing warehouse automation through innovative solutions at Amazon's scale.AIT is seeking a DevOps/Site Reliability Engineer with strong technical skills to join our team. This dynamic team develops and maintains tools for automating the deployment, management, and monitoring of complex material handling systems, including conveyor networks, robotic workcells, and industrial control systems. The engineer will lead initiatives in building highly scalable and reliable solutions that orchestrate and integrate equipment across Amazon's global network of automated fulfillment centers.This position offers the opportunity to work at the intersection of modern DevOps practices and industrial automation, helping to build the future of automated material handling systems at Amazon's scale.Key job responsibilitiesDesign and implement automation solutions for deployment and configurationDevelop monitoring and diagnostic tools for MHE systems including conveyors, sorters, and roboticsCreate and maintain CI/CD pipelines for industrial control systems softwareImplement predictive maintenance solutions using sensors and real-time data analyticsAutomate IPC/PLC program deployment and version control across multiple facilitiesBasic Qualifications Experience leading the design, automation, deployment, and support of large-scale infrastructure Bachelor's degree Experience with CI/CD pipelines build processes Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Python, Ruby, Golang, Java, C++, C#, Rust Experience with Linux/Unix 5+ years of systems design, software development, operations, automation, and process improvement experience Experience with Industrial Control Systems and PLC programming.Preferred Qualifications Experience with distributed systems at scale Experience leading the design, build and deployment of complex and performant (reliable and scalable) software solutions in production Experience writing technical documents, project plans and progress reports to leadership and to stakeholders Experience with robotic workcell integration and programmingAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $136,100/year in our lowest geographic market up to $235,200/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A2897612
